page.title: 10CALDER AND HEBBLE NAVIGATION
page.content: The canal was completed in 1774. The design of the bridges, lock-keepers' cottages, paddle-gear and bollards are unique to the navigation. Commercially it served corn and textile mills and a malt industry. Other cargoes were coal, lime and stone. Lee, Nephew & Sons & Squire Ratcliffe & Sons (Textiles) were notable mill- owners. Their mills have now been sub- let to small businesses, having no association with the canal. Bass Charrington has continued the Malt Industry initially established by Crowther. The C.& H.N.declined due to railway and motor lorry competition, but today enjoys a revival being maintained by British Waterways Board to serve the expanding pleasure cruising industry.
